name: Burkina Faso
description: Burkina Faso, meaning 'Land of the Upright Ones' in the Mossi language, is a landlocked country in West Africa. Known for its rich cultural heritage, diverse landscapes, and significant agricultural potential, it faces challenges related to poverty, desertification, and political instability. The country is characterized by a Sahelian climate, transitioning from savanna to semi-arid conditions.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Burkina Faso has a growing population, primarily rural.
quickFacts.detail: The population is concentrated in the south and west, with significant nomadic populations in the north.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Ouagadougou is the political, economic, and cultural center of the country.
quickFacts.detail: It's a vibrant city known for its artistic scene and annual film festival.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Burkina Faso is slightly smaller than the state of Colorado.
quickFacts.detail: It's bordered by Mali to the south, Niger to the east, Benin and Togo to the west, and Ghana to the northwest.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: French is the official language, but numerous regional languages are spoken.
quickFacts.detail: Mossi, Fulani, and Bobo are among the most widely spoken indigenous languages.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The currency is the West African CFA franc.
quickFacts.detail: It's pegged to the euro and the French franc.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Burkina Faso's economy is largely based on agriculture.
quickFacts.detail: Key sectors include agriculture, mining, and services.

climateData.title: Climate of Burkina Faso
climateData.description: Burkina Faso experiences a tropical savanna climate, characterized by distinct wet and dry seasons. The north is semi-arid, while the south is more humid. Temperatures are generally high throughout the year.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season (November - April)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This is the hottest and driest period of the year, with temperatures often exceeding 40°C (104°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season (May - October)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings significant rainfall, transforming the landscape and supporting agricultural growth.

naturalWonders.name: Wadi Agouf
naturalWonders.description: Wadi Agouf is a stunning waterfall and river system located in the eastern part of Burkina Faso. The cascading waters create a beautiful oasis amidst the arid landscape, offering a refreshing escape and a glimpse into the country's natural beauty.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The waterfall is fed by the Niger River and surrounded by lush vegetation. It's a popular spot for picnics, swimming, and wildlife viewing. The surrounding area is also home to diverse bird species.

naturalWonders.name: Arly National Park
naturalWonders.description: Arly National Park is a vast, pristine rainforest in the north of Burkina Faso, renowned for its incredible biodiversity and unique ecosystem. It's a vital habitat for numerous endangered species and a crucial area for carbon sequestration.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park is characterized by towering trees, diverse plant life, and a rich array of animal species, including chimpanzees, forest elephants, and various bird species. It's a challenging but rewarding destination for experienced trekkers and wildlife enthusiasts.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Burkina Faso
ecosystemData.overview: Burkina Faso’s ecosystems are diverse, ranging from the Sahelian savanna to the tropical rainforests of the north. These ecosystems support a wide range of plant and animal life, playing a crucial role in the country’s biodiversity and economy.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: Burkina Faso is home to a variety of mammals, including elephants, baboons, antelopes, and various carnivores.

statistics.details: Threatened by poaching and habitat loss

notableSpecies.name: African Elephant
notableSpecies.significance: Keystone species, vital for ecosystem health

notableSpecies.name: Chimpanzee
notableSpecies.significance: Important for seed dispersal and forest regeneration

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: Burkina Faso boasts a rich avifauna, with over 400 bird species recorded, including migratory birds and endemic species.

statistics.details: Important stopover site for long-distance migrants

activities.title: Activities in Burkina Faso
activities.description: Burkina Faso offers a range of activities for adventurous travelers, from wildlife safaris to cultural immersion experiences. However, it's crucial to plan carefully and respect local customs.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the diverse landscapes of Burkina Faso on foot, from savanna trails to rainforest paths.

activities.name: Savanna Trekking
activities.description: Trek through the vast savanna, observing wildlife and experiencing the local culture.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, water bottle, sunscreen, insect repellent

activities.name: Forest Hiking
activities.description: Challenge yourself with a hike through the dense Arly National Park.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, waterproof clothing, insect repellent, machete (recommended)

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the rivers and lakes of Burkina Faso for swimming, fishing, and kayaking.

activities.name: River Fishing
activities.description: Cast a line and try your luck at catching local fish species.
activities.requirements: Fishing license (if required), fishing rod and tackle

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, scarf, gloves
clothing.yearRound: Comfortable walking shoes, sunscreen, insect repellent

equipment.basic: Backpack, water bottle, flashlight, first-aid kit
equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
